intro: Typhalea varians, commonly known as the variable typhalea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Typhalea varians is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
